entry.title: Why do I not care about exponential increase?

link.title: Why do I not care about exponential increase?

entry.summary: During the intial days of the Wuhan pandemic some folks were talking about exponential increase of positive cases but for a random individual when they go out they would think like,”Hey, I am fine. Nothing has happened to me nor to the folks in my immediate surrounding why should I care about exponential increase.” Fair point I should say because here their safety is cemented down by their confirmation bias.

entry.title: April 2021, Meditations
entry.summary: “One lesson from affiliating a tree is that same lesson of inherency, of what is, without the least regard to what the looker on (the critic) supposes or says, or whether he likes or dislikes” Walt Whitman Oh, the passenger How, how he rides Oh, the passenger He rides and he rides He looks through his window What does he see? He sees the silent hollow sky He sees the stars come out tonight He sees the city’s ripped backsides He sees the winding ocean drive And everything was made for you and me All of it was made for you and me ‘Cause it just belongs to you and me So let’s take a ride and see what’s mine Iggy Pop, The Passenger “Someone has a great fire in his soul and nobody ever comes to warm themselves at it, and passers-by see nothing but a little smoke at the top of the chimney” Vincent Van Gogh “we’re looking for a junior developer with the experience of a senior developer for the salary of an intern” A random post in LinkedIn.
